bug.short_desc: Resized Flash embeds in an HBox have issues with focus

long_desc.thetext:
Here is playground code with some random flash game from the internet.
var flash = new qx.ui.embed.Flash('http://www.gamedesign.jp/flash/sudoku/sd.swf'); this.getRoot().add( flash, {top: 10, bottom: 10, left: 10, right: 10} );
This works on FF 3.0 / Flash 10.0 r22 / OS X 10.5.7 This does not work on Ubuntu 9.04 64-bit / FF3.5 nor FF3.0 / Flash 10.0 r22 64-bit alpha It also does not work on Ubuntu 9.04 32-bit / FF2.0 / Flash 10.0 r22 32-bit
So my guess is that it's somehow related to the linux flash plugin.

I forgot to add the actual problem!
On linux, with firefox, the embedded flash is unable to keep focus. Once we click it registers the one click, then it looses focus. I have to click away (somewhere else) and then click again, for the next click to be registered by the embedded flash app.
The same flash file on the original webpage, as well when opened directly in the browser does not have this problem.
Also, i picked a totally random flash file I found online. It had the exact same problem our flash files had. So, it shouldn't be related to the flash files themselves.
Chris, any ideas? Please get in touch with Ralf.
I have no idea and at the moment I coudn't analyze it. Ralf, have you found a workaround or a solution for that? Or is the issue gone with a new Flash Player plug-in?
